Event.name: Eventive_affecting
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes some change (the <fen>Event</fen>) that is (or is construed as) punctual. (This frame exists mainly to allow common FEs to be inherited.)
<ex><fex name="Event">This</fex> <t>happens</t> <fex name="Entity">to me</fex> <fex name="Frequency">all the time</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">The area</fex> was <t>struck</t> <fex name="Event">by tragedy</fex> <fex name="Time">in 1996</fex>, <fex name="Time">when an assassin killed 35 people in Port Arthur.</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the event which occurs and affects the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies where the event takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Explanation</fen> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the entity, concrete or abstract.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).</def-root>

lexUnit.name: see.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: experience the occurrence of an event.

lexUnit.name: hit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to occur suddenly and with less-than-desirable consequences.

lexUnit.name: what become (of).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (questioning the subject) happen (to) [implying likely negative impact on the entity affected]

lexUnit.name: suffer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to have something bad happen to oneself, typically physical harm "He suffered a spinal cord injury in high school.."
